Description: Template WordPress_Multi_AZ: WordPress is web software you can use to create a beautiful website or blog. This template installs a highly-available, scalable WordPress deployment using a multi-az Amazon RDS database instance for storage. It demonstrates using the AWS CloudFormation bootstrap scripts to deploy WordPress. **WARNING** This template creates an Amazon EC2 instance, an Application Load Balancer and an Amazon RDS database instance. You will be billed for the AWS resources used if you create a stack from this template.

VpcId.Description: VpcId of your existing Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)
VpcId.ConstraintDescription: must be the VPC Id of an existing Virtual Private Cloud.

DefaultVPCSecurityGroup.Description: Default Security Group of the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) Created
DefaultVPCSecurityGroup.ConstraintDescription: must be the VPC Id of an existing Virtual Private Cloud.

IAMInstanceProfile.Description: IAM Role Policy  Launching the EC2 Instances

PrivateSubnets.Description: The list of SubnetIds in your Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)
PrivateSubnets.ConstraintDescription: must be a list of at least two existing subnets associated with at least two different availability zones. They should be residing in the selected Virtual Private Cloud.

PublicSubnets.Description: The list of SubnetIds in your Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)
PublicSubnets.ConstraintDescription: must be a list of at least two existing subnets associated with at least two different availability zones. They should be residing in the selected Virtual Private Cloud.

KeyName.Description: Name of an existing EC2 KeyPair to enable SSH access to the instances
KeyName.ConstraintDescription: must be the name of an existing EC2 KeyPair.

InstanceType.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid EC2 instance type.

SSHLocation.Description: The IP address range that can be used to SSH to the EC2 instances
SSHLocation.ConstraintDescription: must be a valid IP CIDR range of the form x.x.x.x/x.

DBClass.ConstraintDescription: must select a valid database instance type.

DBName.ConstraintDescription: must begin with a letter and contain only alphanumeric characters.

DBUser.Description: The MySQL database admin account username
DBUser.ConstraintDescription: must begin with a letter and contain only alphanumeric characters.

DBPassword.Description: The MySQL database admin account password

MultiAZDatabase.Description: Create a Multi-AZ MySQL Amazon RDS database instance
MultiAZDatabase.ConstraintDescription: must be either true or false.

WebServerCapacity.Description: The initial number of WebServer instances
WebServerCapacity.ConstraintDescription: must be between 1 and 5 EC2 instances.

Properties.GroupDescription: Enable HTTP access via port 80/443/8080/8000/8118 locked down to the load balancer + SSH access
